_exec_summary.SummaryText:
This document contains all required information in order to meet 40 CFR 68 "Risk Management Program". This document consists of the executive summary and registration data elements (68.155 through 68.185). 



1.0 RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES 



Helmitin, Inc. (Helmitin) has flammable gases (Propane, Butane) on site that requires protection as defined under the Occupational Safety & Health Administration (OSHA) Process Safety Management (PSM) regulation (29 CFR 1926.64). Helmitin has implemented a PSM program to provide information to employees to deal with the risks involved with the storage, handling and processing of highly hazardous materials. The program emphasizes the application of management controls and standard operating procedures when addressing the risks associated with handling or working near highly hazardous chemicals. This Risk Management Plan (RMP) summarizes the worst-case and alternative scenarios for a release of these flammable gases, the management systems and monitoring systems in place to prevent such a release, and the training and employee participation in the PSM program. In accordance with the 2004 amendment to the RMP regulations, the off-site consequence analyses (OCA) are not included in this executive summary. 



2.0 PROCESS DESCRIPTION AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES 



A gas house operation charges propellant in adhesive aerosol products. The gas house operation includes the gas house, propellant storage tanks, and associated transfer equipment and piping. The propellant is pumped from one of the two storage tanks to the filling station in the gas house. The propellant feed rate is controlled by parameters setup in the PLC panel. The propellants stored in the two storage tanks are the RMP regulated substances propane and butane. The propellant is a mixture of propane and butane. 



3.0 GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL - SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS 



Helmitin has developed an OSHA PSM pro

gram for the gas house operation and associated storage tanks. At Helmitin, the listed propellants used in the gas house operation fall under the RMP Program 3 Prevention Program, which is identical to the OSHA PSM program. EPA has said that if the process is in compliance with OSHA PSM, then it is compliance with RMP Program 3. Thus, PSM has been reviewed and determined to be complete for the RMP document. This is a process with initial training including both classroom and on the job. 



4.0 FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY 



There have been no accidents in the previous 5 years. 



5.0 EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN



An Emergency Action Plan has been submitted to the local fire department and Emergency Management Agency.  Helmitin will rely on local responders in the event of a release. 



6.0 PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY 



No safety changes are planned.
